intro: Cichlanthus schultesii, commonly known as the Schultesi's cichlorus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
